summary: Level 1 Save game. Main quest done. Start on shipwreck. Dragon waiting outside.
descriptionHtml:
Save game By Request - Made for friend - He liked it ...someone else might.

Main Quest done - Just wants to be challenged, explore and kill dragons.

Hates fast travel and the main quest requires way too much walking.
Wants to play without using it.
I warned him the whole game is not very \"No Fast Travel\" friendly.

Frightened woman: \"Help\"

Dragonborn: \"First tell me why you traveled half way across the map to ask me.
...Did you miss the four of five towns and two borders on the way here.
Just saying, looks kind of foolish.\"
 
Frightened woman: \"Really, the programmers did not think so. So, help or not.\"

Dragonborn: \"Sure, why not. This Jarl just gave me a job in someone else\'s hold.
I don\'t think he has jurisdiction there but I am doing it anyway. ...Is it a rush job
because it will take me three or four days to get there walking.\"

Frightened woman as she runs off: \"No, take your time. They will wait for you.\" 

Anyway ...

Level 1 - Save game (Nord male) … Fresh install of game (No Mods)
Put it in your save game folder ...load up Skyrim and look for \"Shipwreck_By_Dragon\"
Game 25 on mine

Set for Sword and Bow ... His play style

Smithing, one handed, light armor, speech craft, marksman, & sneak at 30
Everything else is default 15

Start inside shipwreck, somewhere on north coast of Skyrim. 
Lost your map and got hit in the head too many times, so you
are not sure exactly where you are : ) 
Read as \"all map markers off\" ... explore to find them again.
You remember passing Dawnstar to the east so it will be the closest town.

Being hit in the head too many times is probably the reason you are level 1 again
(requested low level character ...Level one is low)

The Story:
After main quest you just wanted to get away to a sunny beach.
You bought a secondhand ship, hired a crew, found some women/men
for a party on board and sailed away.
It was not a very good ship or crew but all you could afford.
(have to work on your speachcraft)

The party on board was amassing, if you ever recall it.
You decided to take a nap below deck. 
\"Too much mead\" is what was said when you left the party on the deck. 
 
When the crew you hired saw the dragon in the distance they took to the rowboats.
Sad to say … They took all your good stuff and the women/men from the party with them.
Apparently holding a grudge for just you, an unnamed dragon watched your hired help
leave before shouting your ship to pieces and landing it on shore.
This woke you up.

The dragon waiting outside now has his own plan for you.
(If the dragon did not kill them, a couple of small angry mud crabs 
will be waiting to chew at your feet while you fight the dragon.)

Exiting the ship though the hole in the hold makes the dragon go away.
(Do not do that ...It will bite you in the ass later and I have no idea where he goes.)
 
You are currently wearing nothing because you just woke you up.
(People do not really sleep in their armor … Do they?)
Party Clothes and boots from main quest by bed if you are shy 
or don\'t want to fight a dragon naked.
Not much difference with \"Party clothes\" on or naked. 
I am sure there are some weapons of your liking around somewhere.

Hope for good loot from the first dragon because there is a harder one 
to the east and the bandits in their camp do not even soften him up for you. 
To the west there may be some dueling mages and wolves. 
More wolves and a Frost troll east if you get by the second dragon.

(First play though went to level 4 by the time I reached Dawnstar ...Needed some Ale by then)

No undone quests in the journal as requested, even miscellaneous ones clear.
Used sneak and invisibility to get by most enemies and did not loot chests.

example: bandits and Draugr at Bleak Falls Barrow will still be there as well as loot.

Too many spoilers to explain choices made in main quest. 
See readme file with save game for who, what, where, and why if it matters to you.

A word of warning : This is a very dangerous area for a level 1 character and 
it is said dragons are harder to kill after the main quest ...unconfirmed ...

Have fun, don\'t waste arrows and remember you have shouts from the main quest,
use them or die easy!
author: A wanderer
